Package shakkiBotti9000PC

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • shakkiBotti9000PC.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls and updates the the positions of pieces and contains utility methods for the minMax algorithm
    Author:
    Antti Alho

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      The board constructor generates the starting positions for each peace on the board.

    • Method Detail

      • canEat

        public java.lang.Boolean canEat​(Piece piece,
                                int x,
                                int y)
        return true if piece can eat another piece from the target position
        Parameters:
        piece - that is going to eat
        x - x coordinate where piece is going to eat
        y - y coordinate where piece is going to eat
        Returns:
        true if eating is possible. False if can't eat.

      • getLegalMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getLegalMoves​(java.lang.Boolean colour)
        goes trough all certain coloured pieces on the board and asks for all the legal moves
        Parameters:
        colour - boolean representation of the colour use Piece.WHITE or Piece.BLACK for clarity
        Returns:
        ArrayList of legal moves on the board player can take

      • move

        public void move​(Move move)
        executes the changes changes to the board that are saved in the move object.
        Parameters:
        move - object that is to be executed and saved in to the move stack.

      • undo

        public void undo()
        takes the last move from the move stack and moves the piece back where it came from

      • containsPiece

        public java.lang.Boolean containsPiece​(int x,
                                       int y)
        returns true if the given position contains piece returns false if the position does not contain a piece
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate where to look for piece
        y - y coordinate where to look for piece
        Returns:
        true / false

      • containsEnemy

        public java.lang.Boolean containsEnemy​(Piece piece,
                                       int x,
                                       int y)
        Return true if target position contains enemy piece
        Parameters:
        piece - which piece is going to move
        x - x coordinate of target position
        y - y coordinate of target position
        Returns:
        returns true if piece at x y has different colour

        y - y coordinate where to remove pieces

        Returns:
